org.hbase.async

Class RegionClientStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hbase.async.RegionClientStats

  • public final class RegionClientStats
extends Object
    RegionClient usage statistics.

    This is an immutable snapshot of usage statistics of the region client. Please note that not all the numbers in the snapshot are collected atomically, so although each individual number is up-to-date as of the time this object is created, small inconsistencies between numbers can arise.

    Since:
    1.7

    • Method Detail

      • rpcsSent

        public long rpcsSent()
        Represents the total number of RPCs sent from this client to the server, whether they were successful or not.
        Returns:
        The number of RPCs sent over TCP to the server

      • inflightRPCs

        public int inflightRPCs()
        Represents the number of RPCs that have been sent to the region client and are currently waiting for a response. If this value increases then the region server is likely overloaded.
        Returns:
        the number of RPCs sent to region client waiting for response.

      • pendingRPCs

        public int pendingRPCs()
        The number of RPCs that are queued up and ready to be sent to the region server. When an RPC is sent, this number should be decremented and rpcsInFlight incremented.
        Returns:
        the number of RPCs queued and ready to be sent to region server.

      • rpcID

        public long rpcID()
        The current RPC ID. This can be used to track the number of RPC requests sent from this region client. Note that the counter is initialized at -1 when a new client has been instantiated but no RPCs sent. It increments from there and may rollover quickly, returning negative values. This is acceptable as HBase doesn't care about the RPC ID as long as it's unique.
        Returns:
        the current RPC ID.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Whether or not this region client has been marked as dead and should not be used for requests. This likely means the host or server has failed or we simply can't connect any more.
        Returns:
        whether this region client has been marked as dead and should not be used for requests.

      • remoteEndpoint

        public String remoteEndpoint()
        The remote endpoint of the region server this client is connecting to.
        Returns:
        the host name (or IP address) of the region server this client is connecting to.

      • pendingBatchedRPCs

        public int pendingBatchedRPCs()
        The number of batched RPCs waiting to be sent to the server.
        Returns:
        the number of batched RPCs waiting to be sent to the server.

      • rpcsTimedout

        public long rpcsTimedout()
        The number of RPCs that timed out due to not receiving a response from HBase in a configurable amount of time.
        Returns:
        The number of RPCs timedout

      • writesBlocked

        public long writesBlocked()
        The number of times sending an RPC was blocked due to the socket send buffer being full. This means HBase was not consuming RPCs fast enough.
        Returns:
        The number of writes blocked due to a full buffer.

      • rpcResponsesTimedout

        public long rpcResponsesTimedout()
        Represents the number of responses that were received from HBase for RPCs that were already timed out by the client. A fairly high number means HBase is busy but recovered.
        Returns:
        The number of late responses received from HBase

      • rpcResponsesUnknown

        public long rpcResponsesUnknown()
        Represents the number of responses that were received from HBase that were for RPCs the region client supposedly did not send. This means something really strange happened, i.e. we had a corrupt packet or HBase is sending responses for another connection.
        Returns:
        The number of unknown responses from HBase

      • inflightBreached

        public long inflightBreached()
        The number of times RPCs were rejected due to there being too many RPCs in flight and waiting for responses from the HBase server. Failed RPCs throw a PleaseThrottleException
        Returns:
        The number of times we rejected RPCs due to a full inflight queue.

      • pendingBreached

        public long pendingBreached()
        The number of times RPCs were rejected due to there being too many RPCs in the pending queue, i.e. while we were waiting for HBase to respond to the connection request. Failed RPCs throw a PleaseThrottleException
        Returns:
        The number of times we rejected RPCs due to a full pending queue.
